meanings.definition: To underestimate the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: She misrates her own abilities and doesn't realize how talented she is.
meanings.sent2: It is not fair to misrate someone's efforts without understanding the hard work they put in.
meanings.sent3: The cat misrates the toy mouse, thinking it's not as fun as it actually is.
meanings.sent4: Don't misrate the power of a kind word; it can make a big difference in someone's day.
meanings.sent5: He misrates the importance of spending time with family, not realizing how precious those moments are.

meanings.definition: To assign a lower rate or value to something than is deserved.
meanings.sent1: The teacher misrates the student's essay, failing to see the depth of research put into it.
meanings.sent2: It's disappointing when companies misrate the quality of their products just to make more profit.
meanings.sent3: The chef misrates the simple dish, not realizing its comforting and delicious taste.
meanings.sent4: She misrates the beauty of the sunset, not appreciating the colors and serenity it brings.
meanings.sent5: Never misrate the impact of a small act of kindness; it can brighten someone's day in unexpected ways.
